Summary: Regression Testing for Existing Login Flow
Description: Conduct regression testing to ensure that the existing login flow is not affected by the new password reset feature.
AcceptanceCriteria:
Existing login functionality is tested and passes without issues.
No new defects are introduced in the login flow.
Regression test results are documented and reviewed.

Description: Implement a feature allowing users to reset their password using a one-time code sent via email.
AcceptanceCriteria:
User receives an OTP via email upon request for password reset.
OTP expires after 10 minutes.
User can reset password using a valid OTP.

Description: Develop test cases for OTP verification during password reset.
AcceptanceCriteria:
Positive test case: User successfully resets password with a valid OTP.
Negative test case: User fails to reset password with an expired OTP.
Negative test case: User fails to reset password with an invalid OTP.

Description: Implement rate limiting to restrict the number of password reset attempts.
AcceptanceCriteria:
User can attempt password reset a maximum of 3 times per hour.
Exceeding the limit results in a temporary block for further attempts.
User receives a notification when the rate limit is reached.

Summary: Audit Event for Successful Password Reset
Description: Log an audit event whenever a password is successfully reset.
AcceptanceCriteria:
An audit event is generated upon successful password reset.
Audit event includes user ID and timestamp of the reset.
Audit logs are accessible for verification purposes.
